result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawntell F. Castrogiovanni was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: 30 hrs. Community Service in Lieu of payment.
Defendant may petition to expunge if successful 973.015

timeConds.notes: In lieu of payment of costs

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shawntell Fellie Castrogiovanni in court with attorney Cheniqua White.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.   Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights/Appeal Rights.  No Contest plea to Ct.1 - Adjudicated Guilty. Court Orders: Sentence withheld - 1 Yr. Probation. Costs of $443 - 30 Hrs. Community Service in lieu of payment to be completed within 6 months. Complete any treatment deemed necessary. Defendant may petition to expunge if successful 973.015
